@sjw e.g. new team member started last week. Not told what to work on. instead encouraged to get advice from many to decide what to work on.
@sjw indeed - that's where the advice process is key, they'd ask people who have been with Buffer longer to understand those priorities.
@bhavesh @buffer many, Bhavesh! they're all here: https://t.co/BvVcNjJgMX
@sjw here's a diagram from the 'trail guide' (handbook) we're currently putting together to guide new team members: http://t.co/ve34qbh6dP
@sjw it's important to make clear, even with advice, no one tells anyone what to do. There's trust you do what you want + what Buffer needs.
@sjw so, essentially, in that case, you'd get advice from several that it isn't a priority, then you'd decide yourself to not work on it.
@sjw the key to it working is what's called 'the advice process' - you always make the final decision, but you must get advice.
